content:
Some of the most recent female knights include:

1. Dame Mary Beard, a classicist and television presenter, who was appointed a Knight Bachelor in the 2018 Queen's Birthday Honours

2. Dame Sarah Gilbert, an Oxford University professor who co-created the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, was appointed as a Knight Bachelor in 2021 New Year Honours.

3. Dame Theresa Marteau, a professor of behaviour and health at Cambridge University who was appointed a Knight Bachelor in the 2019 Queen's Birthday Honours.

4. Dame Rosemary Squire, a theatre producer and founder of the Ambassador Theatre Group, who was appointed a Knight Bachelor in the 2018 New Year Honours. 

These women have received the honourable title of "Dame" before their name, which is the female equivalent of "Sir" for men.
